nodes.text: The T'zaki were a species of sentient insectoids that shared a hive mind. Their culture accepted slavery, and in the T'zaki language, the word "freedom" translated roughly as "purposelessness." Around the year 40 BBY, Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn thought about how some species, such as the T'zaki, interpreted the concept of slavery differently than humans did.
The T'zaki were first mentioned in the canon novel Master & Apprentice, which was written by Claudia Gray and published in 2019.
